definitions.text:
1. Correspondent; having the same similar external form, shape; like; resembling; as an edifice conformable to model draft.
2. Having the same similar manners, opinions moral qualities.The Gentiles were not made conformable to the Jews, in that which was to cease at the coming of Christ.
3. Agreeable; suitable; consistent; as, nature is conformable to herself.
4. Compliant; ready to follow directions; submissive; obsequious; peaceable; disposed to obey.I have been to you true and humble wife, At all time to your will conformable It is generally followed by to, but good writers have used with. In its etymological sense, that may be conformed, capable of being conformed, it seems not to be used.
